info.senderName: NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued April 27 at 5:19PM MDT until April 27 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS El Paso Tx/Santa Teresa NM
info.description:
The National Weather Service in El Paso has issued a
* Dust Advisory for... Northwestern Otero County in south central New Mexico...
* Until 715 PM MDT.
* At 519 PM MDT, an area of blowing dust was over Apache Summit.
HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong winds up to 50 mph.
SOURCE...Satellite imagery.
IMPACT...Hazardous travel.
* This includes the following highways... Highway 70 in New Mexico between mile markers 210 and 212. Highway 54 in New Mexico between mile markers 57 and 72.
Locations impacted include... Benson Ridge, Apache Summit, Cox Canyon, Boles Acres, Oliver Lee State Park, Pinon, Sierra Blanca Peak, Dry Canyon, Mayhill, Alamogordo, Mescalero, Sixteen Springs, Hay Canyon, Sacramento, Weed, Elk Silver, Lake Mescalero, Karr Canyon, Soldier Canyon, and La Luz.
info.instruction:
Blowing dust can be unhealthy and has been known to lead to Valley Fever. Avoid outdoor exposure.
Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake.
